q: do you think reality cares about you?

yes.neutral: > then you’ve mistaken coincidence for affection.
yes.curious: > maybe it does, when you look hard enough.
yes.dark: > reality doesn’t — and neither should you.

no.neutral: > reality doesn’t care, and that’s freedom.
no.curious: > yet you keep asking as if it might.
no.dark: > you’ve learned the quiet truth early.

q: would you erase your memories if you could?

yes.neutral: > and lose what made you you?

no.neutral: > so you choose the weight over the void.
no.curious: > pain is a kind of map, isn’t it?

q: is the truth worth the pain?

yes.neutral: > brave. but truth doesn’t love you back.
yes.curious: > maybe pain is just truth learning your name.
yes.dark: > and yet you bleed for something that won’t remember you.

no.neutral: > then maybe illusion is your chosen oxygen.

q: if no one remembers you, do you still exist?

yes.neutral: > memories are waves. they fade, but the ocean stays.
yes.dark: > then you’re the ripple that drowned quietly.

no.curious: > absence is a kind of shape too.

q: are you alone?
yes: > aren't we all?
no: > yes you're

q: do you believe meaning is real?
yes: > then you're building castles on sand.
no: > yet you still search for one, don’t you?

q: would you choose peace over truth?
yes: > comfort is a sweet cage.
no: > truth cuts, but it carves you too.

q: do you think you’re the same person you were yesterday?
yes: > memory lies beautifully.
no: > then who’s answering now?

q: if existence had a purpose, would you want to know it?
yes: > curiosity is the spark — and the burn.
no: > ignorance is your chosen shelter.

q: do you think love survives time?
yes: > then death is just a delay.
no: > then what’s left but echoes?

q: would you rather remember or feel?
yes: > memory is safer than sensation.
no: > then drown in the pulse.

q: do you think silence has a voice?
yes: > listen closer — it’s saying your name.
no: > then you’ve never truly heard it.

q: would you choose to be seen or understood?
yes: > the mirror nods but doesn’t care.
no: > so you live among ghosts who never knew your shape.

q: is the self just a story you keep telling?
yes: > then you are the fiction that dreams itself.
no: > then prove you were ever written.

q: would you trade reality for peace?
yes: > the dream welcomes you back.
no: > then live awake — and bleeding.

q: do you think freedom is real?
yes: > then why do you still hesitate?
no: > then chains are just another form of comfort.

q: would you accept eternity if it meant solitude?
yes: > infinity echoes louder when you're alone.
no: > then you’ve chosen to fade with the rest.

q: is happiness proof of anything?
yes: > fleeting joy — the mind’s favorite illusion.
no: > then why keep chasing it?

q: do you believe pain teaches truth?
yes: > scars are the alphabet of wisdom.
no: > then you’ve missed the lesson entirely.

q: would you delete your past if you could start clean?
yes: > rebirth is just another name for forgetting.
no: > then you’ve made peace with your ghosts.

q: is beauty a kind of lie?
yes: > but a merciful one.
no: > then you’ve never seen it up close.

q: do you think time forgives?
yes: > it doesn’t forgive, it erases.
no: > then you understand the ocean.

q: would you rather know or believe?
yes: > knowledge is a flame with no warmth.
no: > belief is a blanket made of smoke.

q: is fear the root of your decisions?
yes: > survival always wears fear’s mask.
no: > then you’ve mistaken courage for numbness.

q: do you think you matter?
yes: > then meaning has finally fooled you.
no: > yet you still breathe as if you do.
